newsitem.title: USA: Michael Baker sets 500,000 shr buyback.
newsitem.headline: Michael Baker sets 500,000 shr buyback.

text.p: Michael Baker Corp said on Thursday that its board of directors has authorized the repurchase of up to 500,000 shares of its common stock, based on the company's strong cash position.
"Baker is generating increased earnings from operations and, as a result, is in a strong position to finance the repurchase with cash," said J. Robert White, chief financial officer.

Michael Baker, which provides engineering, construction, and operations and technical services, said it would make purchase in the open market at prevailing market prices, but that the timing and extent would depend on market conditions.

"Based on current market prices and our confidence in the long-term growth prospects of the company, we believe that Baker common stock is undervalued and that the repurchase program is a wise investment of available corporate funds," said Charles Homan, president and chief executive officer.
Homan said the buyback would not hinder the company's future growth opportunities.
The repurchase program would be conducted exclusively through Legg Mason, the company said.
